column5: Do a smudge with cedar & tobacco. Then put on your PFD while underway.  http://boatsafe.com/nauticalknowhow/rename.htm
She looks purdy now.        Monday she gets new plugs and rotor and wires.Just so she purrs as good as she looks.  Have a new name being made for her aswell.CHILLLAX,N
she looks great!!!!!! and the name is awesome  peps
Dang! Life's GOOD eh!
The boat looks great but I did read somewhere that changing the name of a boat is real bad karma. I hope your fishing doesn't go down the pooper if you change it. lol
It can only get better.LOL
Hey..U gonna arrow me some Antlers soon, Bri?
Waiting for the tags in the mail.  I got a small 7 point If you want it.  Yeah life is good,,,,,,,no ,great.
I need one o'these pleaze!  http://www.ohiosportsman.com/photopost/dat...adamscobuck.jpg
ME TOOOOOOOOO.
u troll with that boat for salmon?
Ahhhhh no. Cougars.  LOL    It,s her boat.
Nice boat!  What does the new name mean? (I lead a sheltered life.)
Ohhhhhh, fancy pancy there B!!!  Very nice.
CHILL,N AND RELAX,N
It keeps her happy ya know.LOL
I see it already has a name Brian ,crappy terribly very very bad things are suppose to happen when ya change a boats name
Somebody once told me that if you rename your boat it is bad luck. Has anybody else herd this?
Looks good Bubba, but you need to cut some holes in that tarp so's ya can stick a fishin' pole out!!!

Rename it bud the renaming myth is from all of the paperwork you have to do if you are a documented vessel....however just to be safe you might want to do the hokkie pookie dance and throw salt over your shoulder 3 times before putting it back in the water.    Art
There is an actual ceremony you can perform to ward off all the bad karma.......http://boatsafe.com/nauticalknowhow/rename.htm.  You'll be fine!!!
Maybe I will keep the name,just change the location from Muskoka to Lake Simcoe.  You guys got me scared now.LOL
Hey Brian.... the rig looks mighty fine How about " THE MISS FISH " for a new name??

The Royal Navy has a long history. In the Days of Fighting Sail, they renamed a few of their own ships. They captured many enemy vessels - French, Dutch, Spanish. For many they kept the original name (sometimes simply anglicized), for others they changed the name. Browsing the list, which also gives the eventual fate of each ship, I didn't see any pattern of particularly bad luck if the name was changed.  It's an interesting list...  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ships..._the_Royal_Navy  "BU" means "Broken Up".  Give 'er a proper christening when you change the name and you should be fine.
Judging by the drinks and snacks in the picture, I'd say the christening was a given. Not that it's any of our business Jim
Yeah!... you'll need a couple rolls of paper towels and 5 gallons of Spic'N Span for a proper cleanup after that!!!... don't ask me how I know that!!!
